subject: [junit] Test FAILED Eclipse and build.xml
msgSnippet: Hello, I am using eclipse IDE and I want to run unit tests as part of the build.xml file. Currently my build.xml file looks like this:
messageBody:
Hello, I am using eclipse IDE and I want to run unit tests as part of
the build.xml file.
Currently my build.xml file looks like this:




<project name="MyProject" default="dist" basedir=".">
<description>
Mitt forste bygg i Eclipse
</description>


<property name="cobertura.dir" value="C:/cobertura-1.8-
bin/cobertura-1.8" />

<path id="cobertura.classpath">
<fileset dir="${cobertura.dir}">
<include name="cobertura.jar" />
<include name="lib/**/*.jar" />
</fileset>
</path>

<taskdef classpath="cobertura.classpath"
resource="tasks.properties" />


<!-- set global properties for this build -->
<property name="src" location="src"/>
<property name="build" location="build"/>
<property name="dist" location="dist"/>
<property name="classes" location="classes"/>
<property name="instrumented" location="instrumented"/>
<property name="xmlreports" location="xmlreports"/>
<property name="htmlreports" location="htmlreports"/>
<property name="xmlcoverage" location="xmlcoverage"/>
<property name="htmlcoverage" location="htmlcoverage"/>


<target name="init">
<!-- Create the time stamp -->
<tstamp/>
<!-- Create the build directory structure used by compile -->
<mkdir dir="${build}"/>

<!-- Cobertura add in -->
<mkdir dir="${classes}"/>
<mkdir dir="${instrumented}"/>
<mkdir dir="${xmlreports}"/>
<mkdir dir="${htmlreports}"/>
<mkdir dir="${xmlcoverage}"/>
<mkdir dir="${htmlcoverage}"/>
</target>

<target name="compile" depends="init"
description="compile the source " >
<!-- Compile the java code from ${src} into ${build} -->
<javac srcdir="${basedir}" destdir="${build}"/>

<!-- Cobertura add in -->
<javac srcdir="${basedir}" destdir="${classes}" debug="yes">
<classpath refid="cobertura.classpath" />
</javac>
</target>


<!-- Cobertura add in -->
<target name="instrument" depends="init,compile">
<!--
Remove the coverage data file and any old
instrumentation.
-->
<delete file="cobertura.ser"/>
<delete dir="${instrumented}" />




<!--
Instrument the application classes, writing
the
instrumented classes into
${build.instrumented.dir}.
-->
<cobertura-instrument todir="${instrumented}">
<!--
The following line causes instrument
to ignore any
source line containing a reference to
log4j, for the
purposes of coverage reporting.
-->
<ignore regex="org.apache.log4j.*" />

<fileset dir="${classes}">
<!--
Instrument all the
application classes, but
don't instrument the test
classes.
-->
<include name="**/*.class" />
<exclude name="**/*Test.class" />
</fileset>
</cobertura-instrument>
</target>

<!-- Cobertura add in -->
<target name="test" depends="init,compile">
<junit fork="yes" forkmode="once" dir="${basedir}"
failureProperty="test.failed">



<!--
Note the classpath order:
instrumented classes are before the
original (uninstrumented) classes.
This is important.
-->
<classpath location="${instrumented}" />
<classpath location="${classes}" />

<!--
The instrumented classes reference
classes used by the
Cobertura runtime, so Cobertura and
its dependencies
must be on your classpath.
-->
<classpath refid="cobertura.classpath" />


<formatter type="xml" />
<test name="${testcase}"
todir="${xmlreports}" if="testcase" />
<batchtest todir="${xmlreports}"
unless="testcase">
<fileset dir="${basedir}">
<include
name="**/*Test.java" />
</fileset>
</batchtest>
</junit>

<junitreport todir="${xmlreports}">
<fileset dir="${xmlreports}">
<include name="TEST-*.xml" />
</fileset>
<report format="frames"
todir="${htmlreports}" />
</junitreport>
</target>






<target name="coverage-report">
<!--
Generate an XML file containing the
coverage data using
the "srcdir" attribute.
-->
<cobertura-report srcdir="${basedir}"
destdir="${xmlcoverage}" format="xml" />
</target>

<target name="alternate-coverage-report">
<!--
Generate a series of HTML files
containing the coverage
data in a user-readable form using
nested source filesets.
-->
<cobertura-report destdir="${htmlcoverage}">
<fileset dir="${basedir}">
<include name="**/*.java"/>
</fileset>
</cobertura-report>
</target>


<!-- Cobertura add in -->

<target name="coverage-check">
<!--<cobertura-check branchrate="54"
totallinerate="100" />-->

</target>


<target name="clean" description="Remove all files created by
the build/test process.">
<delete dir="${classes}" />
<delete dir="${instrumented}" />
<delete dir="${reports.dir}" />
<delete file="cobertura.log" />
<delete file="cobertura.ser" />


<!-- Delete the ${build} and ${dist} directory
trees -->
<delete dir="${build}"/>
<delete dir="${dist}"/>


</target>

<target name="coverage"
depends="compile,instrument,test,coverage-report,alternate-coverage-
report" description="Compile, instrument ourself, run the tests and
generate JUnit and coverage reports."/>



<target name="dist" depends="compile"
description="generate the distribution" >
<!-- Create the distribution directory -->
<mkdir dir="${dist}/lib"/>

<!-- Put everything in ${build} into the MyProject-${DSTAMP}.jar
file -->
<jar jarfile="${dist}/lib/MyProject-${DSTAMP}.jar"
basedir="${build}"/>
</target>
</project>


But when building my project in eclipse I get an error message lik
this:
.
.
.
compile:
test:
[junit] Test XTest FAILED
[junitreport] Transform time: 831ms
coverage-check:
.
.
.
as you can se the junit test fails.

I have also included my two classes (original class and junit test
class):





______________________________________________________________



public class X {

public int met (int number) {
int num = number;
if (num <= 1)
return num*2;
else{
return 666;
}
}


public static void main (String args[]){
System.out.println("magnus...");
}
}


.................................................................



import static org.junit.Assert.*;

import org.junit.Test;


public class XTest {

@Test
public void testMet() {
assertEquals(2, new X().met(1));
//assertEquals(666, new X().met(2));
}

}

_______________________________________________________________


Anyone who knows why this error occurs and how i Can solve it?



Magnus :-)
